Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand have a stellar record against India in ICC events having lost just one game since 1992
India have beaten New Zealand just once in nine attempts in all ICC events since 1992
Both teams have won all four matches so far in the tournament
Dharamsala offers the most swing for fast bowlers in the first ten overs of each innings
Mohammed Siraj and Matt Henry are key components of the respective teams' attacks
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are leading the run charts for India, while Devon Conway, Will Young, and Tom Latham are doing well for New Zealand
Rohit has fallen to Boult four times in 13 ODI innings and averages just 22.25 against him
Tom Latham has five fifties and two centuries in 20 ODI innings against India
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won by 4 wickets (with 12 balls remaining)
The match will be played in Dharamsala
Dharamsala is known for its snow-capped mountains and altitude, which helps fast bowlers
The surface looked very green on the eve of the game but is expected to be shaved off before the start
The temperature is expected to be around 18 degrees Celsius on the day of the match
